etymonline: from ob "toward" (see ob-) + trudere "to thrust" (see extrusion)
from ob "against" (see ob-) + tundere "to beat" from PIE *(s)tud-e- "to beat, strike, push, thrust" from root *(s)teu- "to push, stick, knock, beat" // = dumb // F bright = nimble
from on + set (n.) // outset 开端

ostensible 表面上的 [from ob "in front of" (see ob-) + tendere "to stretch" (see tenet)] // os = ob / pretend / ostensible / extenuate / extenuate / protentous // = pretentious => 向前伸展的 自命不凡的/凶兆的 = flamboyant // F austere = modest
pedant: from pais (gen. paidos) "child" (see pedo-) + agogos "leader," from agein "to lead" (see act (n.))
emeaning: often ostenatious concern for book learning and formal rules / academic / bookish

etymonline: from PIE *ped-yos-, comparative of root *ped- "to walk, stumble, impair" (see peccadillo) // = contemptuous // F commendatory = laudatory 赞扬的
cmeaning: adj. 轻蔑的, 贬低的

etymonline: from per- "through" (see per) + lucere "to shine" (see light (n.)) // = manifest // F cryptic = obscure
cmeaning: adj. 清晰明确的, 易懂的

etymonline: from per- "through, completely, to destruction" (see per) + ire "to go" (see ion)
prp. of petere "rush at, seek" (see petition 请愿, 恳求)
cmeaning: adj. 易怒的, 爱发脾气的

etymonline: 痰的 // = numb // F impassioned = vehement
cmeaning: adj. 冷静的, 无感情的, 淡漠的

etymonline: from pith (n.) 髓+ -y (2) // = brief // F circuitous = verbose
cmeaning: adj. 精练的, 简洁的
adj. 冷静的, 淡定的/风平浪静

etymonline: from L. pensare "to weigh carefully," frequentative of pendere (pp. pensus) "to weigh" (see pendant)
ponder [from pondus (gen. ponderis) "weigh" (see pound (n. 1))] / preponderant 占优势的 // = cumbersome // F gossamer = light
